definition: odd jobs/servant or army orderly doing odd jobs

sentences.english: This is Jim. He's our office assistant.
sentences.chinese: 他是吉姆，是我们办公室的勤杂人员。

sentences.english: The new office boy is a bit thick but he's very willing to help.
sentences.chinese: 新来的勤杂员有点傻，但他很愿意帮助人。

sentences.english: The restaurant handyman will tell you she had the ideas, but he did all the work.
sentences.chinese: 餐厅勤杂会告诉你她的想法，但他的所有工作。

sentences.english: This is Jim. He is our office assistant.
sentences.chinese: 他是吉姆，是我们办公室的勤杂人员。
是我们办公室的勤杂人员。

sentences.english: He rose from office boy to managing director in ten years.
sentences.chinese: 他在十年间由办公室勤杂员升至总司理。

sentences.english: When the orderly leaves, Michael spits the pills in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 等到勤杂工离开后，Michael把药片吐在手中。

sentences.english: Please put the new office-boy up to his duties.
sentences.chinese: 请对新来的勤杂员说明他的职责。

sentences.english: This is a type of wheel suited to home handy-man construction.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种适合家庭型车轮勤杂工建设。
迈克是办公室的勤杂人员。

sentences.english: He rose from office boy to managing director in fifteen years.
sentences.chinese: 他十五年里从办公室勤杂员升到总司理。

sentences.english: She look down on the office girls she have work with.
sentences.chinese: 她瞧不起与她共事的女勤杂工。

sentences.english: Roy is a busboy and so is Joyce.
sentences.chinese: 罗伊是个餐馆的勤杂工，乔伊斯也是。

sentences.english: The writer worked as a busboy for one year.
sentences.chinese: 这位作家曾做过一年的餐馆勤杂工。

sentences.english: Our boss started in as an office boy .
sentences.chinese: 我们老板是从办公室勤杂工开始做起的。

sentences.english: Another one stands in front of him, holding the pill cup.
sentences.chinese: 另一个勤杂工站在他身前，拿着装有药片的纸杯。

definition: to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
civilian post (as opposed to military)/civil service/administration
to help with farm work/casual laborer
